queries.query_name: Non Kube System Pod With Host Mount
queries.description: A non kube-system workload should not have hostPath mounted

files.expected_value: Resource name 'xkops-deployment' of kind 'Deployment' in non kube-system namespace 'default' should not have hostPath '/mnt/logs' mounted
files.actual_value: Resource name 'xkops-deployment' of kind 'Deployment' in non kube-system namespace 'default' has a hostPath '/mnt/logs' mounted

queries.description: Containers should not run with allowPrivilegeEscalation in order to prevent them from gaining more privileges than their parent process

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{xkops-deployment}}.spec.template.spec.initContainers.name={{terraform-init}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false
metadata.name={{xkops-deployment}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{xkops}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false
metadata.name={{xkops-dashboard}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{xkops-dashboard}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false

queries.query_name: Volume Mount With OS Directory Write Permissions
queries.description: Containers can mount sensitive folders from the hosts, giving them potentially dangerous access to critical host configurations and binaries.

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{xkops-deployment}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{xkops}}.volumeMounts.name={{workflows-config-secret}}.readOnly should be defined and set to true

queries.description: Containers should only run as non-root user. This limits the exploitability of security misconfigurations and restricts an attacker's possibilities in case of compromise

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{xkops-deployment}}.spec.template.spec.initContainers.name={{terraform-init}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true
metadata.name={{xkops-deployment}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{xkops}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true
metadata.name={{xkops-dashboard}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{xkops-dashboard}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true

queries.description: Check if containers are running with low UID, which might cause conflicts with the host's user table.
Memory limits should be defined for each container. This prevents potential resource exhaustion by ensuring that containers consume not more than the designated amount of memory
Memory requests should be defined for each container. This allows the kubelet to reserve the requested amount of system resources and prevents over-provisioning on individual nodes
Containers should drop 'ALL' or at least 'NET_RAW' capabilities
The permission to create pods in a cluster should be restricted because it allows privilege escalation.

files.expected_value: metadata.name=xkops-clusterrole.rules.verbs should not contain the value 'create' when metadata.name=xkops-clusterrole.rules.resources contains the value 'pods'
files.actual_value: metadata.name=xkops-clusterrole.rules.verbs contains the value 'create' and metadata.name=xkops-clusterrole.rules.resources contains the value 'pods'

files.expected_value: metadata.name=xkops-clusterrole.rules.verbs should not contain the value 'create' when metadata.name=xkops-clusterrole.rules.resources contains the value 'pods'
files.actual_value: metadata.name=xkops-clusterrole.rules.verbs contains the value 'create' and metadata.name=xkops-clusterrole.rules.resources contains the value 'pods'

queries.description: Roles or ClusterRoles with RBAC permissions to run commands in containers via 'kubectl exec' could be abused by attackers to execute malicious code in case of compromise. To prevent this, the 'pods/exec' verb should not be used in production environments

Roles or ClusterRoles with RBAC permissions to port-forward into pods can open socket-level communication channels to containers. In case of compromise, attackers may abuse this for direct communication that bypasses network security restrictions

queries.query_name: RBAC Roles with Read Secrets Permissions
queries.description: Roles and ClusterRoles with get/watch/list RBAC permissions on Kubernetes secrets are dangerous and should be avoided. In case of compromise, attackers could abuse these roles to access sensitive data, such as passwords, tokens and keys

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{xkops-clusterrole}}.rules[0] should not be granted read access to Secrets objects
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{xkops-clusterrole}}.rules[0] is granted read access (verbs: get, list, watch, create, patch, update, delete) to Secrets objects

queries.description: Check if Readiness Probe is not configured.
Containers should be configured with a secure Seccomp profile to restrict potentially dangerous syscalls

queries.query_name: Service Account Token Automount Not Disabled
queries.description: Service Account Tokens are automatically mounted even if not necessary

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{xkops-deployment}}.spec.template.spec.automountServiceAccountToken should be defined and set to false
metadata.name={{xkops-dashboard}}.spec.template.spec.automountServiceAccountToken should be defined and set to false

queries.description: Service has an external load balancer, which may cause accessibility from other networks and the Internet
Roles and ClusterRoles when binded, should not use get, list or watch as verbs

files.expected_value: The metadata.name={{xkops-clusterrole}}.rules.verbs should not contain the following verbs: [["get", "list", "watch", "create", "patch", "update", "delete"]]

queries.description: CPU limits should be set because if the system has CPU time free, a container is guaranteed to be allocated as much CPU as it requests
CPU requests should be set to ensure the sum of the resource requests of the scheduled Containers is less than the capacity of the node

queries.query_name: Image Pull Policy Of The Container Is Not Set To Always
queries.description: Image Pull Policy of the container must be defined and set to Always

files.actual_value: metadata.name={{xkops-dashboard}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{xkops-dashboard}}.imagePullPolicy relies on mutable images in cache

queries.description: Containers should be configured with an AppArmor profile to enforce fine-grained access control over low-level system resources

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{xkops-dashboard}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations should specify an AppArmor profile for container {{xkops-dashboard}}
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{xkops-dashboard}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations does not specify an AppArmor profile for container {{xkops-dashboard}}

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{xkops-deployment}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations should specify an AppArmor profile for container {{terraform-init}}
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{xkops-deployment}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations does not specify an AppArmor profile for container {{terraform-init}}

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{xkops-deployment}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations should specify an AppArmor profile for container {{xkops}}
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{xkops-deployment}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations does not specify an AppArmor profile for container {{xkops}}

queries.description: Sees if Kubernetes Drop Capabilities exists to ensure containers security context
Each namespace should have a LimitRange policy associated to ensure that resource allocations of Pods, Containers and PersistentVolumeClaims do not exceed the defined boundaries

files.actual_value: metadata.name={{xkops-deployment}} does not have a 'LimitRange' policy associated
metadata.name={{xkops-dashboard}} does not have a 'LimitRange' policy associated

queries.description: Each namespace should have a ResourceQuota policy associated to limit the total amount of resources Pods, Containers and PersistentVolumeClaims can consume

files.actual_value: metadata.name={{xkops-dashboard}} does not have a 'ResourceQuota' policy associated
metadata.name={{xkops-deployment}} does not have a 'ResourceQuota' policy associated

queries.query_name: Pod or Container Without Security Context
queries.description: A security context defines privilege and access control settings for a Pod or Container

files.actual_value: spec.template.spec.initContainers.name=terraform-init does not have a security context
spec.template.spec.containers.name=xkops-dashboard does not have a security context
spec.template.spec.containers.name=xkops does not have a security context

queries.description: Check if the root container filesystem is not being mounted read-only.
Container should not use secrets as environment variables
